1.name: Return / Reject identification
1.description: Identify a return / reject message was received

2.name: Automatic matching
2.description: Match a return / reject message to the original payment

3.name: Manual matching
3.description: Match a return / reject message to the original payment

4.name: Matching to Direct / Cover
4.description: Manual handling of return / reject matching to Direct / Cover

5.name: Adjust party chain
5.description: Swap the debit and credit parties and perform account validation and enrichment only (no debit/credit account derivation)

6.name: MOP Validation
6.description: The credit MOP of the SWIFT Reject / Return message is set as the source MOP of the original payment. GPP performs MOP validation (no MOP Selection)

7.name: Return / Reject Fees
7.description: Apply fees on Reject / Return message

8.name: Return / Reject Compliance and Value date

12.name: Recall request (camt.056) generation
12.description: Recall an outgoing payment (debit MOP = BOOK) which was already transmitted.

13.name: Recall request matching
13.description: Match the generated recall request to the original payment

14.name: Pre-Settlement Recall
14.description: If the recall is generated prior to the original paymentâ€™s settlement date, GPP cancels the original payment and routes the recall to the Service Complete queue

15.name: Recall fee
15.description: Charge the customer for cancellation and recall handling fees.

16.name: Post-Settlement Recall
16.description: Route the recall to the Service Wait queue

17.name: Receive rejection for recall request
17.description: o Link the recall reject message to the recall message o Set the incoming recall reject message status to SERVICE_COMPLETE o Set the outgoing recall message status to SERVICE_REJECTED

18.name: Receive return message
18.description: Perform duplication check, match the return message to the recall request and to the original payment (automatically / manually), set statuses to all the 3 messages

19.name: Receive a recall request (camt.056)
19.description: Set basic properties for the incoming message

20.name: Match a recall request
20.description: Match the received recall request to the original payment

21.name: Reject recall request
21.description: Generate a recall reject message (camt.029) and process it and the original payment accordingly

22.name: Approve recall request
22.description: Generate a return message (pacs.004) and process it and the original payment accordingly
